column4: I have just plugged a planar touch screen into my computer - dmesg tells me that it sees it and I have loaded the evtouch driver - still not able to touch the screen - what am I missing?
USB?
yes - usb
does lsusb sees it?
yes0 sees it as Quanta Computer Inc
So to summarise, screen is working but not reacting to touch?
YES - very sucinct
and I would add that dmesg and lsusb both show it
can you give me the complete model?
planar px2230mw
did you install drivers?
Am looking ad planar.com and they have section for Linux Touch Screen Drivers. Did you get them from there?
evtouch yes - nothing else - never needed anything else when using them in the past - what else may I need
Oh, so the screen worked but it's not working now?
I did not get from there - no - THIS screen has never worked, have always used ELO in the past
can you give me the URL for the drivers you are finding at planar - I thought I had searched their site
Let me just check if site is right.
Gah, they don't have drivers for Linux for that display. :(
I woukd add that it appears to be there in lshal too
It seems to me that you need to configure your X. But am not good at that. Maybe someone here could help you.
but even so - the input device is just an input device - what am I missing here - the screen looks fine
I don't think X sees it as an input device, what does `xinput list` say?
have you given up on me - reason I ask is I am considering a re-boot and so will lose this session
I didn't. I asked what `xinput list` command gives you. Is your display there?
